page.title: 09 Aspal Hall
page.content: There used to be a large moated farmhouse called Aspal Hall,surrounded by a moat on three sides, the fourth side being protected by a very large thatched barn. The farm used to employ ten people and had 30 horses and 26 cows. The grounds of Aspal Hall were very extensive and are now known as The Close - an area of uncultivated grassland with many old oak trees and dried up beds of streams and lakes. It was here that we found the dry bed of The Beck. The Hall and fine old barn were demolished about 20 years ago, just after it was sold, as they had fallen into disrepair. The moat can still be seen and has been preserved in spite of the fact that modern houses have been built on either side of it and a road laid right across the site of the old Hall
